definition: to match/is comparable with
to match/to pair
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: I worked with the patience of a redwood growing rings.
sentences.chinese: 我這種耐心，堪與紅杉樹長年輪媲美。

sentences.english: However, there is not a new kind of chess and chess the two comparable?
sentences.chinese: 然而有沒有一種新的棋藝與兩大棋藝相媲美？

sentences.english: With respect to this character, completely OK with the United States house award is rivalled on the west.
sentences.chinese: 就這一點而言，完全可以與美國的西屋獎媲美。

sentences.english: These pigs, which have an I.Q. comparable to dogs, routinely become psychotic.
sentences.chinese: 這些能和狗的智商相媲美的豬，經常會變得精神失常。

sentences.english: No active fighter can come close to equaling De La Hoya's name recognition and earning power.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個現役拳手能夠媲美霍亞的名聲和票房。

sentences.english: And mine is a positive attachment, flavored with the dopamine pleasure drug.
sentences.chinese: 而且這是積極的結果，和多巴胺帶來的愉悅相媲美。

sentences.english: They have now created a thread rivaling natural silk.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們已經創造出了能與蜘蛛絲媲美的天然絲。

sentences.english: Robert Parker says this wine is comparable with a Grand Cru Classe.
sentences.chinese: 酒評人派克指，此酒的質素可媲美特級酒。

sentences.english: Your achievements are comparable with his.
sentences.chinese: 你的成績可與他的相媲美。

sentences.english: Ming in playing basketball. —Oh, you are really his big fan.
sentences.chinese: 在打籃球方面，無人能與姚明相媲美。

sentences.english: The sunset rivals the sunrise in beauty.
No man could stand alone with him as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一名作家，無人可以與他媲美。

sentences.english: Somebody said that my short novels could stand up to  Mark Twain's.
sentences.chinese: 有人說我的短篇小說可以和馬克吐溫的媲美。

sentences.english: Huawei's growth paralleled the herky-jerky rise of many Chinese firms.
sentences.chinese: 華爲的成長可以媲美其他急劇發展的中國公司。

sentences.english: A few handfuls of raspberries or blackberries will transform the cheapest vodka.
sentences.chinese: 幾小勺覆盆子或黑莓可以媲美廉價的伏特加。

sentences.english: This effectively gave it a strike capability similar to that of an Apache helicopter gunship.
sentences.chinese: 這使得它有媲美阿帕奇武裝直升機的打擊能力。

definition: to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
contend against
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
not inferior in any respect
equally matched/about the same
can be rated as/can be said to be
equally famous
top-notch/first-rate
incomparable
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
to hope to reach/to strive for
no less than/not inferior to
